attributes.action: Stop Hertsmere Council from chopping our remaining 2 Blossom trees down!
attributes.additional_details:
They say we shouldn't be paying for the work, as it's their fault the trees are in the state their in. So the cost is estimated at £320.
Please help to get this viral work done, by someone we trust - so if the trees, planted in 1933, can be saved then they have a fighting chance!
Bless you!
attributes.background:
We've been trying to stop Hertsmere council - namely the Highway Asset management team - from Chopping the last two Passard Plum trees left in Neville Close.
An independent tree surgeon has looked at them and thinks he can save them. So we need authorisation from hertsmere to allow him to do this.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
